tool.name: miRDeep2
tool.description: Find miRNA candidates using output from mapping step
tool.command:
./mirdeep2_wrapper.pl $collapsed_reads $bowtie_index $bowtie_index.extra_files_path $arf_file $mirna_ref $mirna_other $precursors "$html_output.files_path" "$collapsed_reads.name" $csv_output $html_output $survey_output $mrd_output
#if str($min_stack_height) != '': -a $min_stack_height #end if
#if str($max_num_precursors) != '': -g $max_num_precursors #end if
#if str($min_score_cutoff) != '': -b $min_score_cutoff #end if
#if str($disable_randfold) == 'disable_randfold_true': -c #end if
#if str($ucsc_genome) != 'None': -t $ucsc_genome #end if
#if str($star_seq) != 'None': -s $star_seq #end if

param.name: collapsed_reads
param.label: Collapsed reads fasta file
param.help: Collapsed read fasta file outputted from mapping step

param.name: bowtie_index
param.label: Bowtie indexed reference
param.help: Select the bowtie-build run, NOT the fasta reference file you indexed

param.name: mirna_ref
param.label: Known miRBase miRNA sequences in fasta format (optional)
param.help: If used, these should be the known mature sequences for the species being analyzed

param.name: mirna_other
param.label: Known related miRBase miRNA sequences in fasta format (optional)
param.help: If used, these should be pooled known mature sequences for 1-5 species closely related to the species being analyzed

param.name: precursors
param.label: Known miRBase miRNA precursors in fasta format (optional)
param.help: If used, these should be the known precursor sequences for the species being analyzed

param.name: star_seq
param.label: Known miRBase miRNA star sequences in fasta format (optional)
param.help: If used, these should be the known star sequences for the species being analyzed

param.name: min_stack_height
param.label: Minimum read stack height that triggers analysis (optional)
param.help: Using this option disables automatic estimation of the optimal value and all detected precursors are analyzed

param.name: max_num_precursors
param.label: Maximum number of precursors to analyze when automatic excision gearing is used (default 50000)
param.help: If set to -1 all precursors will be analyzed

param.name: min_score_cutoff
param.label: Minimum score cut-off for predicted novel miRNAs to be displayed in the overview table
param.help: This score cut-off is by default 0

param.name: disable_randfold
param.label: Disable randfold analysis
param.help: Runs faster but with less accurate results

param.name: ucsc_genome
param.label: Species being analyzed - this is used to link to the appropriate UCSC browser entry (optional)

data.name: survey_output
data.label: miRNA prediction accuracy spreadsheet of ${tool.name} on ${on_string}

tool.help:
miRDeep2 is a software package for identification of novel and known miRNAs in deep sequencing data. Furthermore, it can be used for miRNA expression profiling across samples.
The output files produced are:
result.html: a html table giving an overview of novel and known miRNAs detected in the data. The table is hyperlinked to pdfs showing the signature and structure of each hairpin.
result.csv: spread-sheet format of results.html
survey.csv: spread-sheet of prediction accuracy for all score-cutoffs between -10 and 10.
output.mrd: text output of the reported hairpins.
